com.cop4331.networking

Class AccountManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cop4331.networking.AccountManager

  • public class AccountManager
extends java.lang.Object
    SINGLETON design pattern The signleton design pattern is used here to limit the amount of concurrent logged in accounts to 1 The type Account manager.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AccountManager.Account
      PROXY Pattern Proxy pattern is used to abstract the server queieries into simplified method calls and callbacks Account class which manages the actions of the currently authenticated user
      static interface  AccountManager.onAccountStatus
      OBSERVER design pattern Notifies other parts of the application about the status of the user's authentication The interface On account status.

      • getInstance

        public static AccountManager getInstance()
        Gets the current instance of the ACcountManager
        Returns:
        the instance

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Attempts to log in the user with the given username and password. If a login is successful then a session token is returned, allowing the user to remain logged in until they sign out
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user's account
        password - the password of the user's account

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String displayName,
                     java.lang.String phone)
        Registers a new user with the Parse server. A successful registration will produce a onRegistered callback. If there were errors while registering then a onRegistrationError callback will occur
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the new account - an error will be produced if this username is already taken
        password - the password the password of the account - must meet a length requirement of 8
        displayName - the display name for the account
        phone - (optional) the phonenumber for the account allowing a user to be searched by their phone number

      • setAccountStatusListener

        public void setAccountStatusListener(AccountManager.onAccountStatus listener)
        Sets the onAccountStatus Listener that should be used for Account callbacks
        Parameters:
        listener - the onAccountStatus to be used

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Checks if a user is currently logged in.
        Returns:
        true if an account is logged in, otherwise false

      • getCurrentAccount

        public AccountManager.Account getCurrentAccount()
        Gets the currently signed in Account
        Returns:
        the Account object of the currently signed in user
